item.title: Add model help {pi}
item.dc:creator: @dutchboy dutchboy
item.description:
@dutchboy wrote:

being able to use models in .dat form, use model ids over 14500 or something. becouse when you add a model, you also remove one with gzips. so if you remove a fence model(like delta did) and add that hat u get hat fences. preloading fixes all

item.title: Add model help {pi}
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

If the models you have are in .dat form you don’t need to add them. You just need to increase the model index and enable preloadModels. You don’t need this, but the usual add model code for PI is just add model. Once you say “add model” a box should come up and you just enter the id.

Read full topic

item.title: Add model help {pi}
item.dc:creator: @stickywicky stickywicky
item.description:
@stickywicky wrote:

here is my add model code

[QUOTE] if(s.startsWith(“add model”))
{
try
{
int ModelIndex = Integer.parseInt(s.substring(10));
byte[] abyte0 = GetModel(ModelIndex);
if(abyte0 != null && abyte0.length > 0){
aClass14Array970[1].method234(abyte0.length, abyte0, (byte)2, ModelIndex);
method77(“Model: [”+ModelIndex+"] added successfully!", 0, “”, aBoolean991);
}else{
method77("Unable to find the model. "+ModelIndex, 0, “”, aBoolean991);
}
}
catch(Exception e)
{
method77("Syntax - ::add model ", 0, “”, aBoolean991);}
}[/QUOTE]
when i go onto my client and do
any of these
add model
add models
addmodel
addmodels
add models “id”
add moddel “id”
::add models
::Add model
::addmodel “id”
::addmodels “id”
non of these actually work :S
so can soem 1 like teach me
